sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: Invitation to celebrate the enlargement of the Photogrammarchiv

tei:div.tei:ab:
Der Generaldirektor der Nationalbibliothek
und
der Vorsitzende des Kuratoriums
des der Musiksammlung der Nationalbibliothek angegliederten
Archives für Photogramme musikalischer Meisterhandschriften beehren sich zu dem am Freitag den 14. Februar 1936, um 5½ Uhr nachmittags in den Räumen der Albertina, Wien, I. Augustinerbastei 6, anlässlich der Erweiterung des Archives stattfindenden Tee höflichst einzuladen.Das Photogrammarchiv in der Nationalbibliothek, Neue Freie Presse, February 15, 1936, Abendblatt, p. 3, is a report of this event, with a list of some of those attending (including Wilhelm Furtwängler, who was the last of the speakers). In describing the extension, it refers to the "new rooms ..., fireproof cabinets, [and] special American photographic equipment." It describes the current holdings of the Archive as including "around 3,000 masterworks with a total of over 60,000 leaves." Other reports appeared in Die Stunde, the Neues Wiener Journal, and Der Wiener Tag. Clippings of these and one other unidentified are preserved in OJ 9/10.

Bei dieser Gelegenheit werden einige Proben aus den Beständen des Archives gezeigt, und gelangen unveröffentlichte Stücke von J. Haydn und W. A. Mozart durch das Mairecker-Quartett und andere Wiener Philharmoniker zur Aufführung.
U. A. w. g. Tel. R 22‒2‒42

The General Director of the National Library
and
the Chairman of the Board of Trustees
of the Archive for Photograms of Musical Manuscripts of the Masters, affiliated to the Music Collection of the National Library, have the honor of inviting you to a tea on Friday February 14, 1936 at 5.30 p.m. in the rooms of the Albertina, Vienna I, Augustinerbastei 6, on the occasion of the enlargement of the Archive.

On this occasion, a number of specimens from the holdings of the Archive will be on display, and unpublished pieces by J. Haydn and W. A. Mozart will be performed by the Mairecker String Quartet and other members of the Vienna Philharmonic.
